Name: Nakama Chapter 8 Counters

Set.一枚・いちまい: 1 thin, flat object/1 thin object/1 flat object/1

Set.二枚・にまい: 2 thin, flat objects/2 thin objects/2 flat objects/2

Set.三枚・さんまい: 3 thin, flat objects/3 thin objects/3 flat objects/3

Set.四枚・よんまい: 4 thin, flat objects/4 thin objects/4 flat objects/4

Set.五枚・ごまい: 5 thin, flat objects/5 thin objects/5 flat objects/5

Set.六枚・ろくまい: 6 thin, flat objects/6 thin objects/6 flat objects/6

Set.七枚・ななまい: 7 thin, flat objects/7 thin objects/7 flat objects/7

Set.八枚・はちまい: 8 thin, flat objects/8 thin objects/8 flat objects/8

Set.九枚・きゅうまい: 9 thin, flat objects/9 thin objects/9 flat objects/9

Set.十枚・じゅうまい: 10 thin, flat objects/10 thin objects/10 flat objects/10

Set.何枚・なんまい: how many thin, flat objects/how many thin objects/how many flat objects/how many

Set.何匹・なんびき: how many fish, animals/how many fish/how many animals/how many

Notes:
Nakama 1 Ch.8's counters + 円 & 階 + Japanese Origin Numbers/General Counters + People
You can find all of this in Appendix D in the Nakama 1 Combined Second Student Edition. (I don't know what it is in the Nakama 1B one.)
Also you can just enter "how many" for all of the counters if you don't wanna type them all out.

examples.一匹・いっぴき:
犬が一匹います。
There is one dog.
examples.七本・ななほん:
私は本棚に七本の本を並べました。

English: I lined up seven books on the bookshelf.
